alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:16PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central El Paso County through 400 PM MDT... At 314 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Black Forest, or 15 miles north of Colorado Springs. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, up to half inch hail and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain could cause localized flooding, especially in areas where the ground is saturated from rainfall that fell yesterday. Locations impacted include... Air Force Academy, Black Forest, Gleneagle, and Falcon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
